title: Internet angry at Allu Arjun's 'celebration' after prison release as boy injured in Pushpa 2 stampede remains critical - Hindustan Times
summary:
Internet angry at Allu Arjun's 'celebration' after prison release as boy injured in Pushpa 2 stampede remains critical

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 09:44 AM IST

Source: Hindustan Times

Allu Arjun's celebratory return home from prison following a high-profile arrest has sparked outrage online, particularly as a young victim from the associated stampede remains in critical condition.

  • Allu Arjun was arrested concerning a fan's death during the premiere of his film Pushpa 2: The Rule.
  • After his release, he was celebrated at home with significant industry support, which many deemed inappropriate given the ongoing tragedy.
  • Many social media users criticized the celebrations, calling it a PR stunt and questioning the lack of support for the deceased's family by Arjun.
  • The incident occurred during a large crowd gathering at Sandhya Theatre, leading to a stampede that resulted in significant casualties.
"Today's non-stop celebrity visits and the publicity around it has tilted the scales in favour of Revanth Reddy... It should have been a day of introspection, not celebration."

The critic response reflects a broader sentiment that celebrity culture can overshadow genuine human tragedy, urging a consideration of the consequences of such public displays amidst personal loss.

Yogi Adityanath on the impeachment notices against Allahabad HC judge Shekhar Kumar Yadav and Jagdeep Dhankhar - The Hindu
summary:
Yogi Adityanath on the impeachment notices against Allahabad HC judge Shekhar Kumar Yadav and Jagdeep Dhankhar

Publication Date: December 15, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath criticized the Opposition for initiating impeachment notices against Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar and Allahabad High Court's Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav, asserting that truth-tellers face threats of impeachment.

  • Adityanath spoke at the World Hindu Economic Forum on December 14, 2024.
  • He accused the Congress party of double standards and attempting to suppress the truth.
  • He advocated for a Uniform Civil Code, emphasizing respect for the majority community's sentiments.
  • The BJP leader remarked on the Opposition's concerns about his rise from a farmer's son to his current position.
  • He stated that India's economy is on track to become the third largest by 2027.
"Whoever speaks the truth, these people will pressurise him with impeachment (motions), and still they talk about the Constitution. Look at their double standards." - Yogi Adityanath

Adityanath emphasized that the Sanatan religion promotes inclusivity without claiming superiority, affirming its historical significance and contribution to India's legacy.

‘Whoever speaks truth…’: Adityanath backs VP Dhankhar, HC judge - Hindustan Times
summary:
‘Whoever speaks truth…’: Adityanath backs VP Dhankhar, HC judge

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath expressed support for Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar and an Allahabad High Court judge, criticizing the impeachment motions brought against them and claiming that those who speak the truth face threats of impeachment.

  • Adityanath stated that those who “speak the truth” in India are threatened with impeachment.
  • The comments were made in context of impeachment motions against VP Dhankhar and Justice Shekhar Yadav.
  • He emphasized the need for a Uniform Civil Code in India, defending Judge Yadav's opinion on the matter.
  • Adityanath spoke at the World Hindu Economic Forum in Mumbai, accentuating the opposition's perceived threat to truth-tellers.
  • He accused the Congress party of “strangulating” the Constitution historically.
“Whoever speaks the truth, these people will pressurise him with impeachment, and still they talk about the Constitution.” - Yogi Adityanath

Adityanath's remarks highlight the ongoing tension between the government and opposition parties regarding allegations of political motivations behind impeachment motions, suggesting a call for a more respectful discourse surrounding truth and governance in India.

title: 'Nehru Model Failed, We're Trying To Correct It Since 2014': S Jaishankar - NDTV
summary:
Nehru Model Failed, We're Trying To Correct It Since 2014: S Jaishankar

Publication Date: November 7, 2024

Source: NDTV

In a recent address, External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar discussed the failures of the 'Nehru development model' and the ongoing efforts to correct its consequences since 2014.

  • Jaishankar stated that both Russia and China reject the economic assumptions of the Nehru era.
  • The 'Nehru development model' has influenced India's politics, bureaucracy, and education.
  • He emphasized a strong need for a course correction post-2014, but acknowledged this task remains challenging.
  • Jaishankar quoted John Foster Dulles on India's independence to highlight past geopolitical misconceptions.
  • He pointed out a national consensus on the model's failure but noted a reluctance to explore alternatives.
  • The current environment requires more focus on resiliency, reliability, and trust rather than just openness.
"As a result, we end up doing the reforms we must, rarely the reforms we should." - S. Jaishankar

Jaishankar concluded that the idea of 'Atmanirbharta' should be about self-reliance without equating to protectionism, emphasizing the importance of national security and thoughtful action.

title: Divide Within PCB Over Acceptance Of Champions Trophy 2025 'Compensation': Report - NDTV Sports
summary:
Divide Within PCB Over Acceptance Of Champions Trophy 2025 'Compensation': Report

Publication Date: November 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) is facing internal discord following its acceptance to host the 2025 Champions Trophy in a hybrid model, allowing India to play their matches in Dubai. Many PCB members are dissatisfied with this decision and the perceived compensation offered.

  • The ICC confirmed a hybrid model for the Champions Trophy 2025, causing dissent in the PCB.
  • As compensation, Pakistan will play in the 2026 T20 World Cup in Colombo.
  • Former captain Rashid Latif criticized the hybrid model and the future ICC events offered as insufficient compensation.
  • Latif referred to the compensation as a "lollipop," questioning its true benefit to Pakistan.
"This is a lollipop the ICC is giving to the PCB... that if you agree to this, don't ask for anything in writing and we will give you another ICC event. This won't be of any benefit (to Pakistan)." - Rashid Latif

Internal conflicts within the PCB highlight the complexities of international cricket negotiations, as members debate the adequacy of the hybrid model and its implications for Pakistan cricket moving forward.

title: Donald Trump To Get $15 Million From ABC News In Defamation Suit Over Anchor's 'Rape' Remark - News18
summary:
Donald Trump To Get $15 Million From ABC News In Defamation Suit Over Anchor's 'Rape' Remark

Date: December 15, 2024 | Source: News18

US President-elect Donald Trump will receive $15 million from ABC News as part of a defamation lawsuit settlement related to inaccurate claims made by anchor George Stephanopoulos regarding a civil liability for rape.

  • ABC News anchor George Stephanopoulos claimed that Trump had been civilly found liable for raping E. Jean Carroll.
  • The settlement includes $1 million for legal fees to Trump's attorney.
  • ABC News issued a public statement expressing regret over the remarks made on the March 10 episode of "This Week."
  • The settlement agreement was signed after a Florida federal judge ordered separate depositions for both Trump and Stephanopoulos.
  • ABC News is required to transfer $15 million for Trump’s library into an escrow account within 10 days.
"We are pleased that the two parties have reached an agreement to dismiss the lawsuit on the terms in the court filing." - Jeannie Kedas, ABC News spokesperson

This settlement marks a significant legal victory for Donald Trump, allowing him to receive a large sum from a major news network over defamatory remarks made on air.

title: Mohammed Siraj riles up Gabba crowd, Australia with 'bail flip', Marnus Labuschagne responds - Watch - The Times of India
summary:
Mohammed Siraj riles up Gabba crowd, Australia with 'bail flip', Marnus Labuschagne responds - Watch

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Mohammed Siraj continued his lively antics during the Border Gavaskar Trophy, notably at the Gabba, where he engaged the crowd and fellow cricketer Marnus Labuschagne with a 'bail flip' moment.

  • On Day 2 of the Brisbane Test, Siraj flipped the bails at the striker's end to unnerve Labuschagne.
  • Labuschagne responded by flipping the bails back, much to the cheers of the crowd.
  • This playful exchange came after a previous incident between the two during the Adelaide Test.
  • Siraj received boos from the crowd upon his arrival to bowl at the Gabba after a tumultuous outing in Adelaide.
  • In a prior match, both Siraj and Labuschagne faced penalties for their heated exchanges on the field.
“Siraj later gave a fiery send-off to local boy Travis Head after dismissing him, which led to recurring boos from the crowd.”

This latest incident adds to the ongoing rivalry and drama between the players and highlights the spirited environment of international cricket.

title: Trump to receive $15 million and apology from ABC News over anchor George Stephanopoulos’s ‘rape’ remark - The Times of India
Sambhal officials reopen ancient temple closed since riots in 1978 - Hindustan Times
summary:
Sambhal officials reopen ancient temple closed since riots in 1978

Publication Date: December 15, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Sambhal district officials have reopened the Bhasma Shankar temple, which had been closed since the communal riots of 1978. This reopening is a significant moment for the local Hindu community after decades of displacement.

  • The temple was discovered during an anti-encroachment drive near Shahi Jama Masjid.
  • A Hanuman idol and a Shivling were found during the inspection.
  • Sub-Divisional Magistrate Vandana Misra highlighted the discovery and the decision to reopen the temple.
  • Local residents, including Mukesh Rastogi, claim the temple is over 500 years old and has significant historical importance.
  • The reopening follows recent violence related to a survey of the Shahi Jama Masjid.
"We all came here together and decided to reopen the temple," - Vandana Misra, Sub-Divisional Magistrate.

The reopening of the Bhasma Shankar temple marks a restorative step for the community, allowing local residents to reconnect with a significant part of their heritage that had been inaccessible for decades.

title: Diljit Dosanjh talks about Allu Arjun's Pushpa; dedicates Chandigarh concert to chess world champion Gukesh. Watch - Hindustan Times
summary:
Diljit Dosanjh talks about Allu Arjun's Pushpa; dedicates Chandigarh concert to chess world champion Gukesh. Watch.

Date: Dec 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Singer Diljit Dosanjh dedicated his concert in Chandigarh to newly crowned chess world champion Gukesh D. He praised Allu Arjun's film Pushpa and shared his thoughts on both topics during the performance.

  • Diljit dedicated his Chandigarh concert to Gukesh, encouraging attendees with a motivational message.
  • Gukesh D. recently became the youngest FIDE World Champion after defeating China's Ding Liren.
  • Diljit watched Pushpa: The Rise but not its sequel, Pushpa 2: The Rule, and praised the film.
  • Pushpa 2 has become the highest-grossing Indian film of 2024, earning ₹1100 crore within nine days of its release.
  • Punjab CM Bhagwant Singh Mann's wife attended the concert; an advisory was issued to avoid alcohol-themed songs during the performance.
"Today's show is dedicated to world chess champion Gukesh. Do you know why it is dedicated to him? Because whatever you think in life, he has already thought about becoming a world champion. And he became that. Problems are there, I face them daily."

Overall, Diljit Dosanjh's concert highlighted both his admiration for Gukesh's achievements in chess and his appreciation for the film Pushpa, engaging the audience with inspirational messages and entertainment.

Bigg Boss 18: Vivian Dsena’s wife Nouran questions him over his bond with Karan Veer Mehra; says, “You ha - The Times of India
summary:
Bigg Boss 18: Vivian Dsena’s wife Nouran questions him over his bond with Karan Veer Mehra; says, “You having a soft corner for him boils my blood”

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

The latest Bigg Boss 18 promo reveals an emotional confrontation between Vivian Dsena and his wife, Nouran Aly, over his friendship with co-contestant Karan Veer Mehra, which has stirred up tensions.

  • Nouran expresses her displeasure about Vivian's bond with Karan, stating, “You having a soft corner for him boils my blood.”
  • She reminds Vivian of his promise to stay focused in the game, suggesting he seems lost.
  • Nouran hints at feeling isolated, stating that none of the housemates are her true friends.
  • The promo hints at varied reactions from other contestants, with some empathizing with Vivian's situation.
  • The online fan community is divided over Nouran’s reaction, sparking debates about the nature of friendships in the Bigg Boss house.
“You having a soft corner for him boils my blood.” - Nouran Aly

The upcoming episode is expected to be one of the most engaging yet, with personal relationships and gameplay dynamics at stake, leaving fans eagerly anticipating how this confrontation will affect Vivian and Karan's relationship.

"Do Mongrels Simply Purr?": Sunil Gavaskar Hits Back At Australia Crowd Booing Mohammed Siraj - NDTV Sports
summary:
"Do Mongrels Simply Purr?": Sunil Gavaskar Hits Back At Australia Crowd Booing Mohammed Siraj

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

Former Indian cricketer Sunil Gavaskar criticized Australian fans and players for their treatment of Indian pacer Mohammed Siraj after a controversial incident during the second Test in Adelaide.

  • Gavaskar condemned the hypocrisy of Australian fans, suggesting they would cheer if the roles were reversed.
  • Siraj faced criticism for a fiery send-off directed at Australian batsman Travis Head, which Gavaskar believes was unjust.
  • Despite receiving a demerit point and a 20% fine on his match fees, Gavaskar noted the importance of the Indian Premier League in reducing animosity in cricket.
  • Gavaskar humorously questioned whether Australian cricketers are "mongrels" who only bark in the context of aggressive play.
"Siraj is getting the stick from all the 'saints' in Australian cricket who, of course, were known for their impeccable behaviour on the field... So, do mongrels simply purr, or do they bark, too?" - Sunil Gavaskar

Gavaskar's remarks highlight the double standards in cricket fan culture and emphasize a call for fair treatment of players regardless of nationality.

NASA’s Perseverance Rover Reaches the Top Rim of the Jezero Crater - Universe Today
summary:
NASA's Perseverance Rover Reaches the Top Rim of the Jezero Crater

Publication Date: December 12, 2023 | Source: Universe Today

NASA’s Perseverance rover has successfully reached the top of Jezero Crater's rim, marking a significant milestone in its mission to explore the ancient Martian landscape.

  • The rover climbed 500 vertical meters over three and a half months to reach "Lookout Hill".
  • Perseverance will now begin its "Northern Rim" campaign, aiming to explore geological samples over the next year.
  • Four previous science campaigns have been completed since its landing in February 2021.
  • The rover's current mission involves investigating new geological features and ancient environments.

“The Northern Rim campaign brings us completely new scientific riches as Perseverance roves into fundamentally new geology..." - Ken Farley, Project Scientist

As Perseverance begins to explore areas less affected by ancient impacts, it remains focused on finding biosignatures from Mars' wetter past, contributing to our understanding of the planet’s history and potential for life.

title: ‘I think we all know…’: D Gukesh clarifies if he meant to publicly call out Magnus Carlsen to a championship challenge - Hindustan Times
summary:
‘I think we all know…’: D Gukesh clarifies if he meant to publicly call out Magnus Carlsen to a championship challenge

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

D Gukesh has made headlines after becoming the youngest world chess champion. Following his victory over Ding Liren, he expressed a desire to challenge Magnus Carlsen for a match, sparking discussions in the chess community.

  • D Gukesh defeated China's Ding Liren in Game 14 to become the youngest world chess champion at age 18.
  • Despite his win, Gukesh stated he doesn't consider himself the best player, acknowledging Magnus Carlsen's status.
  • Gukesh expressed a wish to compete against Carlsen, calling it an amazing opportunity and the toughest challenge in chess.
  • Carlsen responded to Gukesh's comments, indicating he is not interested in returning to competitive play.
  • Gukesh acknowledged Carlsen's previous statements about not enjoying the championship process but remains hopeful for a match.
“Winning World Chess Championship does not mean I am the best player, obviously that is Magnus Carlsen. I want to reach the level Magnus has achieved.”
“It will be, first and most importantly the biggest challenge that I can possibly face as a chess fan and as a chess player who wants to improve himself. I would love it if Magnus comes back, he is clearly the best and probably the greatest of all time.”

D Gukesh's historic win and his remarks about Magnus Carlsen have ignited interest in the chess world, leaving fans curious about the possible return of Carlsen to the championship scene.

title: India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 2 Live Score: Bumrah all over AUS like a rash; openers dismissed; Smith troubled - Hindustan Times
summary:
India vs Australia Live Score 3rd Test Day 2: Bumrah all over AUS like a rash; openers dismissed; Smith troubled

Publication Date: Dec 14, 2024 11:15 PM IST

Source: Hindustan Times

Jasprit Bumrah dominated the Australian batting lineup by taking early wickets on Day 2 of the 3rd Test at the Gabba, putting India in a favorable position despite rain disruptions on Day 1.

  • Bumrah dismissed openers Usman Khawaja (21) and Nathan McSweeney (9) early on Day 2.
  • India's bowling strategy showed promise as they targeted key Australian players like Steve Smith and Marnus Labuschagne.
  • Both teams faced interruptions due to rain, having only bowled 80 deliveries on the first day.
  • India made changes to the playing XI with Akash Deep and Ravindra Jadeja replacing Harshit Rana and Ravichandran Ashwin.
"There's a lot of grass and it looks a little soft as well so we want to try and make the best use of the conditions and try and see what we can do with the ball up front." - Rohit Sharma

In summary, the first few hours of Day 2 highlight India's strong start, particularly due to Bumrah's performance, which increases their chances of taking control over the match proceedings against Australia.

title: Kolkata woman rejects brother-in-law's advances, he kills and severs her head - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kolkata woman rejects brother-in-law's advances, he kills and severs her head

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 06:01 AM IST

Source: HT News Desk

Within 24 hours of finding a woman's severed head at a garbage dump in south Kolkata's Tollygunge area, her brother-in-law was arrested for allegedly killing her.

  • Atiur Rahman Laskar, the victim's brother-in-law, allegedly killed her after she rejected his advances.
  • The victim's severed head was found in a garbage dump near Graham Road on Friday.
  • Laskar, a construction worker, confessed to the murder and was arrested from his native village in South 24 Parganas' Diamond Harbour.
  • The victim had been separated from her husband for two years and worked as a domestic help in the Regent Park area.
  • Laskar's advances were rejected, which infuriated him, leading to the murder.

"On Thursday evening, after she was done with work, he forced her to accompany him to an under-construction building. He strangulated her there and then beheaded her. He cut the body in three parts and dumped those," DCP (South Suburban) Bidisha Kalita said.

The incident sent chills down the residents' spines, triggering fear in the locality. The police are investigating the possible involvement of other people in the crime.

title: 'Pushpa 2' box office collection day 10: The film sees huge growth of 71 percent on Saturday, post Allu A - TOI Etimes
Dilip Kumar Stood Beside Raj Kapoor, Asked Him To 'Wake Up' After He Suffered Cardiac Arrest: 'Acting Mat K - News18
summary:
Dilip Kumar Stood Beside Raj Kapoor, Asked Him To 'Wake Up' After He Suffered Cardiac Arrest: 'Acting Mat Kar'

Publication Date: December 14, 2024, 21:02 IST

Source: News18

Veteran actress Saira Banu commemorated Raj Kapoor on his centenary, sharing touching memories of his friendship with Dilip Kumar, especially during challenging times.

  • Saira Banu shared a video on Instagram recalling the bond between Raj Kapoor and Dilip Kumar.
  • The video included light-hearted moments of the two actors, such as playing cricket and joking around.
  • Banu emphasized that despite perceptions of rivalry, they were childhood friends from Peshawar.
  • She recounted a poignant moment when Dilip Kumar rushed to Raj Kapoor's side after his cardiac arrest, expressing deep emotions.
  • Dilip Kumar whispered to Raj Kapoor, urging him to wake up and reminiscing about their joyous times together.
“Raj, wake up! I’ve brought the ‘khushboo’ of Chapli Kebabs. Let’s walk through the bazaar, like we used to eating kebabs, laughing, and reminiscing. Bas ab acting mat kar; take me back to Peshawar.” – Dilip Kumar

This heartfelt tribute from Saira Banu highlights the enduring friendship and affection between two legends of Indian cinema, reminding fans of the depth of human connections beyond fame.
